job.name: SFTP
job.description: Import /Export file(s) from/to an SFTP server.

task.name: sftp-connector
task.description: Import files from (or export files to) an SFTP (SSH FTP) server using an SFTPConnector task. The task requires the following third-party credential: {key: sftp://<username>@<hostname>, value: SFTP_PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. It is launched with the following parameters: $SFTP_HOST (required) is the IP address of the server host. $SFTP_PORT (optional) is the listening port. Default value is 22. $SFTP_USERNAME (required) is the username used for accessing the server. $SFTP_MODE (required) is the used transfer mode. We have two possible values: GET or PUT. $SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH (optional) is the local relative path from which we upload (or to which we download) file(s). SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH can contain either a path to a file, a directory terminated by / or an empty value for the root. $SFTP_REMOTE_RELATIVE_PATH (optional) is the remote relative path to which we upload (or from which we download) file(s). $SFTP_EXTRACT_ARCHIVE is a boolean used only when $SFTP_MODE=GET. If it is equal to True then, the imported file will be extracted if it is an archive.

variable.name: INPUT_T_D
variable.model: PA:SPEL(! (variables['SFTP_MODE'].equals("PUT") ? ( variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH'].endsWith('/') || variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH'].isEmpty() ? variables['INPUT_T_D'] = variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH'] + '**' : variables['INPUT_T_D'] = variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH']) : variables['INPUT_T_D'] = "non_existent_folder" ) .isEmpty())

variable.name: OUTPUT_T_D
variable.model: PA:SPEL(! (variables['SFTP_MODE'].equals("GET") ? ( variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH'].endsWith('/') || variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH'].isEmpty() ? variables['OUTPUT_T_D'] = variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH'] + '**' : variables['OUTPUT_T_D'] = variables['SFTP_LOCAL_RELATIVE_PATH']) : variables['OUTPUT_T_D'] = "non_existent_folder" ) .isEmpty())
